patients_rights.title: Patients' Rights Charter
patients_rights.description: OneCell Medical Clinic's Patients' Rights Charter. Information about the rights and obligations of patients.
patients_rights.right1_content: Patients have the right to receive appropriate healthcare services for their health protection, without discrimination based on gender, age, religion, status, or economic circumstances. Medical professionals cannot refuse treatment without justifiable reason.
patients_rights.right2_content: Patients have the right to receive sufficient explanations from doctors, nurses, etc. about their medical condition, treatment methods, expected results (including side effects), and medical costs. They can ask detailed questions and have the right to decide whether to consent to treatment methods.
patients_rights.right3_content: Patients have the right to have their physical and health-related information protected. Medical professionals and institutions cannot disclose or publish confidential information without the patient's consent, except in cases specified by law such as criminal investigations.
patients_rights.right4_content: Patients can seek consultation and remedies if their rights are violated, resulting in harm to life, physical condition, or financial loss.
patients_rights.obligation1_title: 1. Obligation to Trust and Respect Medical Professionals
patients_rights.obligation1_content: Patients must accurately inform medical professionals about their health-related information and trust and respect the treatment plans of medical professionals.
patients_rights.obligation2_title: 2. Obligation Not to Receive Medical Treatment by Fraudulent Means
patients_rights.obligation2_content: Patients must identify themselves before treatment and must not receive medical treatment by fraudulent means, such as using another person's identity.
